ISSUE.TITLE: Bug: Audit log for external database not visible through UI
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this ### Steps to reproduce ? 1. Set up an external database 2. Select the base in NocoDB (in the example below, 0.202.8 is external) 3. Go to Data Sources tab 4. There is no button to view the audit log for the external database; only the default one ![image](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/assets/35540322/a5a66392-260c-4de0-b82a-c68d11d9e965) Looked in the backend, there are logs in `nc_audit_v2`, just seems they are not exposed through the UI? ### Desired Behavior Add a button for auditing the external database, just like there is for the default one. ### Project Details Node: **v18.17.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** RootDB: **mysql2** PackageVersion: **0.202.8** ### Attachments _No response_

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: fix: set dateTime picker default time to current time always

COMMIT.MESSAGE: fix: Audit log for external database not visible through UI #7165
